main_definition: To change from one person, thing, or action to another; to replace.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Changed the channel on a television or radio. For example: 'I switched the TV to Channel 5.'
meanings_and_examples.example: 'She quickly switched from watching news to a comedy show on TV.'

meanings_and_examples.definition: Replaced one item with another in terms of equipment, settings, etc. For example: 'He switched his laptop for a new model.'
meanings_and_examples.example: 'The office manager switched the printers because the old ones were outdated.'

meanings_and_examples.definition: Changed from one job or position to another. For example: 'After working at the factory, he switched careers and became an engineer.'
meanings_and_examples.example: 'She decided to switch her major from biology to computer science in college.'

meanings_and_examples.definition: Switched off or turned out; extinguished. For example: 'The firefighter switched the water hose on, hoping to put out the flames.'
meanings_and_examples.example: 'After the power outage, we had to switch our flashlights on to see in the dark.'

meanings_and_examples.definition: Changed one's opinion or allegiance. For example: 'The politician switched parties after disagreeing with their policies.'
meanings_and_examples.example: 'After years of loyalty, she felt it was time to switch sides and vote for a different candidate in the election.'
